com.facebook.battery.metrics.api

Class SystemMetricsCollector<T extends SystemMetrics>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.battery.metrics.api.SystemMetricsCollector<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppWakeupMetricsCollector, BluetoothMetricsCollector, CameraMetricsCollector, CompositeMetricsCollector, CpuFrequencyMetricsCollector, CpuMetricsCollector, DeviceBatteryMetricsCollector, NetworkMetricsCollector, RadioStateCollector, TimeMetricsCollector, WakeLockMetricsCollector

    public abstract class SystemMetricsCollector<T extends SystemMetrics>
extends java.lang.Object
    Takes snapshots of a given metric. There are generally two types of metrics collectors - - those that depend on an underlying api, such as the CpuMetricsCollector which reads from /proc. - those that are simply boxes of values and are triggered by custom instrumentation, such as the CameraMetricsCollector which should be triggered with every call to the android camera api.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract T createMetrics()
      Creates an empty instance of the corresponding system metrics.
      abstract boolean getSnapshot(T snapshot)
      Note that access to snapshot instances is not synchronized and must be taken care of by the caller requesting getSnapshot.

      • getSnapshot

        public abstract boolean getSnapshot(T snapshot)
        Note that access to snapshot instances is not synchronized and must be taken care of by the caller requesting getSnapshot.
        Parameters:
        snapshot - snapshot on which the data will be written
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot has been updated with valid data.

      • createMetrics

        public abstract T createMetrics()
        Creates an empty instance of the corresponding system metrics.

        Explicitly having this function available reduces a significant amount of boilerplate

        Returns:
        New System Metrics object
